t: Psalm 25
Dependence on the Lord
Of David.
Lord,*spn I appeal to you.
My*ln God, I trust in you. Do*ln not let me be disgraced; do*ln not let my enemies gloat over me.
No*ln one who waits for you will*ln be disgraced; those*ln who act treacherously without cause will*ln be disgraced.
Make*pn your ways known to me, Lord;*s teach*ln me your paths.
Guide*ln me in your truth and teach me, for*ln you are the God of my salvation; I*ln wait for you all day long.
Remember,*ln Lord,*s your compassion and*ln your faithful love, for*ln they have existed from antiquity.
Do*ln not remember the sins of my youth or*ln my acts of rebellion; in*ln keeping with your faithful love, remember me because*ln of your goodness, Lord.*s
The*pn Lord*s is good and upright; therefore*ln he shows sinners the way.

All*ln the Lordâ€™s*s ways show faithful love and truth to*ln those who keep his covenant and decrees.
